alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 31 at 1:53PM CDT until September 01 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ..Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected Friday Afternoon Across Far Southwest Nebraska... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM MDT, OR 1 PM to 8PM CDT, FRIDAY FOR LOW HUMIDITY AND GUSTY SOUTH WINDS... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 210 Frenchman Basin across far southwest Nebraska. * WIND...From the south at 10 to 20 mph with gusts over 25 mph expected. * HUMIDITY...as low as 15 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
